You can set the zone filling method to another type by using IOcrPage.AutoZone(OcrZoneParser zoneParser, NativeOcrZoneFillMethod fillMethod, OcrProgressCallback callback) with fillMethod set the zone type desired.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Ocr.NativeOcrZoneParser
member.summary: The zone parser used when automatically performing page-layout decomposition (auto-zoning).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.NativeOcrZoneParser.Default
member.summary: The OCR engine will determine at runtime which algorithm will be applied. It depends from trade-off and language setting.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.NativeOcrZoneParser.Legacy
member.summary: Simple page decomposition. It is faster but less accurate than NativeOcrZoneParser.Standard.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.NativeOcrZoneParser.Standard
member.summary: The most accurate page parsing algorithm.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.NativeOcrZoneParser.Fast
member.summary: This algorithm can be treated as a simplified variant of NativeOcrZoneParser.Legacy. This algorithm does not try to find tables on the page. It is the fastest (but least accurate) parsing algorithm available. Use it only for simple page parsing tasks.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.NativeOcrZoneParser.Leadtools
member.summary: Use LEADTOOLS MRC zoning. This option is not supported in this version of LEADTOOLS.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrAutoPreprocessPageCommand
member.summary: Performs page pre-processing commands

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrAutoPreprocessPageCommand.Deskew
member.summary: Automatic deskewing. If the image is skewed, the IOcrPage.AutoPreprocess method will try to deskew it

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrAutoPreprocessPageCommand.Rotate
member.summary: Automatic rotation. If the image is rotated (its view perspective is anything other than top-left), the IOcrPage.AutoPreprocess method will auto orient it to top-left. This command is especially useful if the image upside-down.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrAutoPreprocessPageCommand.Invert
member.summary: Automatic inversion. If the image is black and white and is inverted (contains white on black data), the IOcrPage.AutoPreprocess method will automatically convert the image data to be black on white

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrAutoPreprocessPageCommand.All
member.summary: Run all the commands (Deskew, Rotate, Invert)

member.summary: The original image reference. This image is used by the OCR engine internally and should not be disposed. The original image is not null when this page is created by adding an image from a file, URL or stream or when the value of the "Recognition.ShareOriginalImage" setting is true. Otherwise, the engine will return a null reference for this value.

member.summary: Character set filter.

member.summary: No character filters.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Digit
member.summary: Recognition of numerals. For example: "3" (Digit Three).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Uppercase
member.summary: Recognition of uppercase letters, including accented ones. For example: "A" (Capital A).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Lowercase
member.summary: Recognition of lowercase letters including accented ones. For example: "a" (Lowercase a).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Alpha
member.summary: Upper and lowercase letters. This is a combination of (Uppercase | Lowercase).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Punctuation
member.summary: Recognition of punctuation signs. For example: "!" (Exclamation Mark).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Miscellaneous
member.summary: Recognition of other miscellaneous characters. For example: "+" (Plus sign).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.All
member.summary: All characters. Since all elements are enabled, there is no filtering. This a combination of Digit (| Uppercase | Lowercase | Punctuation | Miscellaneous).

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Plus
member.summary: Enables the use of the "FilterPlus" characters. The FilterPlus characters are added after any filtering.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneCharacterFilters.Numbers
member.summary: Digits plus the "FilterPlus" characters This is a combination of (Digit | Plus).

member.name: T:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType
member.summary: Zone types.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Text
member.summary: Flowing text type zone.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Table
member.summary: Table type zone.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Graphic
member.summary: Zone containing graphics.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Omr
member.summary: OMR (Optical Markup Recognition) zone.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Micr
member.summary: MICR (Magnetic Ink Character Recognition) zone. Check processing. Currently, the engine does not auto-detect MICR zones. Instead, use MICRCodeDetectionCommand to detect the MICR zone area automatically, if needed, and add an OcrZone object with OcrZoneType.Micr to the page. After the zone with MICR data is recognized, call the ExtractMicrData method to parse the row data into an OcrMicrData object.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Icr
member.summary: ICR (Intelligent Character Recognition) zone. Handwritten text and numbers.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Mrz
member.summary: MRZ (Machine Readable Zone). Only applicable to passports and identity cards. Travel passports worldwide are MRPs (machine-readable passports). They are standardized by the ICAO Document 9303 (endorsed by the International Organization for Standardization and the International Electrotechnical Commission as ISO/IEC 7501-1) and have a special machine-readable zone (MRZ). MRZs are usually at the bottom of the identity page at the beginning of a passport. MRZ text uses capital letters and digits separated by one or more \< characters (for example, `P<OcrZoneType.Mrz to the page. After a zone with MRZ data is recognized, call IOcrZoneCharacters to parse the row data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Barcode
member.summary: Barcode zone. Currently, the engine does not auto-detect barcode zones. Instead, call the BarcodeReader to detect the barcode zone area(s) automatically, if needed, and add an OcrZone object with OcrZoneType.Barcode to the page. For future use by LEADTOOLS.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.None
member.summary: No recognition zone.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.FieldData
member.summary: Field data zone (for example, the name, address, and date fields in passports and identity cards). Field data uses capital letters, digits, and separators. Currently, the engine does not auto-detect field data zones. Set field data manually if a zone is known to contain field data. After a zone with field data is recognized, call IOcrZoneCharacters to parse the row data.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.Cmc7
member.summary: CMC7 zone filling method. ConnectCode MICR CMC7 font is based on the CMC-7 (ISO 1004) industry standard.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Ocr.OcrZoneType.OcrA
member.summary: OCR zone
